oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview and performance - Shelby Lynne and Allison Moorer - 2017-09-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with and performances by Shelby Lynne and Allison Moorer from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 15, 2017. Includes audio from video. Moderated by Ann Powers. In partnership with the Americana Music Association.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ann Booth; Shelby Lynne; Allison Moorer;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (18:57) Opening comments by Abi Tapia and introduction of Cliff O'Sullivan / (19:25) Cliff O'Sullivan opening comments / (20:05) Introduction of artists by Abi Tapia / (20:57) Plays excerpt from the Fly Low, Stay Close documentary video which includes a live performance of the song Lungs from the album Not Dark Yet / (25:15) Introduction of Ann Powers, Shelby Lynne and Allison Moorer / (25:42) Opening comments by Ann / (28:18) Allison talks about the song selections for the album / (29:37) Shelby talks about her relationship to Townes Van Zandt / (30:15) Allison talks about growing up in Alabama / (32:10) Shelby talks about musical background and the Fiddlers convention in Frankville Alabama / (34:13) Talk about their family, family musical background and singing together / (37:08) Talk about sister and sibling harmony and working together singing and recording / (39:35) Shelby talks about her phrasing /

(41:00) Allison talks about her evolution as a vocalist and writer / (42:12) Talk about the song I'm Looking For Blue Eyes / (43:40) Performs I'm Looking For Blue Eyes (Allison and Shelby) / (47:02) Talk about Jessi Colter and the musical inspiration of female country acts / (48:45) Talks about musical influences other than country / (50:14) Shelby and Allison tells tour bus story / (52:08) Plays documentary video excerpt of the song Into My Arms / (54:25) Talks about the songs on the new album, the song Into My Arms and Nick Cage / (56:50) Shelby talks about the song Lithium on the new album / (58:43) Allison answers question about how each others singing has influenced each of them / (01:01:03) Shelby talks about Allison's vocal ability / (-1:02:19) Allison talks about Shelby's songs and her favorites / (01:03:08) Talks about producer Teddy Thompson and working on the album with him / (01:05:49) Ann asks what they've learn about song writing from covering other people's material /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Booth, Ann; Lynne, Shelby; Moorer, Allison; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
